import requests

# Replace this with the actual IP address of your PC (Windows machine running Flask)
PC_IP = "192.168.1.100"  # <- Example IP, replace with actual
PORT = 5000

url = f"http://{PC_IP}:{PORT}/trigger"

try:
    response = requests.post(url)
    if response.status_code == 200:
        data = response.json()
        print("✅ Response from PC/CANoe:", data["canoe_response"])
    else:
        print("❌ Failed with status code:", response.status_code)
except Exception as e:
    print("❌ Error during request:", str(e))

import socket

UDP_IP = "192.168.x.x"  # Replace with CANoe PC IP
UDP_PORT = 5000

message = b"Hello CAPL!"

sock = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_DGRAM)
sock.sendto(message, (UDP_IP, UDP_PORT))

# Receive reply
data, _ = sock.recvfrom(1024)
print("📬 Received from CANoe:", data.decode())
